title: Citi China Supports New Initiative to Help Rural Enterprises in Hubei Province
summary: Hong Kong – Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi") and the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD), today announced the launch of a new initiative known as "Citi-CFFPD Sustainable Rural Enterprise Train the Trainer Program."
tag-1: Citi China Supports New Initiative to Help Rural Enterprises in Hubei Province
tag-3: Hong Kong – Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi") and the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD), today announced the launch of a new initiative known as "Citi-CFFPD Sustainable Rural Enterprise Train the Trainer Program."
tag-4: The program, sponsored by Citi Foundation, aims to provide household enterprises with technical and practical training on growing oil tea camellia and chestnut trees. Training will also focus on sustainable agriculture techniques, with the objective of increasing farmers' income levels while also creating permanent job opportunities.
tag-5: Wang Li, Director of Citizenship for Citi China, Madam Li Xiaolin, Honorary Chairman of CFPPD and Vice President of CPAFFC, 60 trainers and guests from local government and the Hong An Forestry Bureau attended the launch ceremony, which was held in Hong An County, Hubei province.
tag-6: Training will initially be conducted with 60 farmers from 43 villages via three separate courses. These farmers will then act as trainers for 1,200 low-income rural household enterprises, which have an average annual income level of USD180, in their respective villages. Rural household enterprises are small family run businesses with up to six members. It is expected that through their newly acquired skills, farmers will be able to increase their crop yield levels by at least 100 percent and their income levels by at least 30 percent by 2012.
tag-7: Wang Li, Director of Corporate Social Responsibility for Citi China, said, "Citi is delighted to be part of this initiative, which will help low income individuals and household businesses in an area of China where this help is much needed. We will continue to support programs around China that make a positive and meaningful contribution to the greater community as we build our own business here over the long term."
tag-8: Madam Li Xiaolin, Honorary Chairman of CFPPD and Vice President of CPAFFC, said, "This program will not only greatly improve income of local farmers, but also promote long-term, sustainable development of the local economy."
tag-9: In an effort to help local farmers increase income levels without causing harm to the environment, the Hong An county government encourages local household enterprises to grow oil tea camellia and Chinese chestnut trees through the provision of free seeds. These crops have a positive impact on the environment and produce higher economic yields. Under the initiative, the farmers will learn how to graft, manage high yield and prune oil tea camellia and Chinese chestnut trees. Each course will last for two weeks and be followed by practical field work training. Training will also encompass sustainable agriculture techniques, such as reducing reliance on chemical fertilizers and pesticides, and improving soil and product quality through soil and water conservation techniques.
